title: Are you genuinely happy?
body:
RIOT

Are you genuinely happy having the state of the game being: 3 assassins vs 3 assassins, with a poor ADC and support as sideliners that just get caught up in the ensuing mayhem?

Is that the perfect picture of the game in your eyes? 
Its been like this all season, and god help us its even worse now.

Being deleted in under a second is acceptable when there is **one** member of the enemy team, whose entire job is to do that one thing, and then is useless afterwards. 
But being deleted separately in under a second by 3 different assassins (all with over 3000 HP), who then go on to prove how not-useless they are, by slaughtering the rest off your team as well, is NOT my idea of a healthy game.

1 fighter, 1 tank, 1 mage, 1 ADC, 1 Support. That is the utopian team.
You can then mix it up a bit, maybe take away the support and add another tank if they have a lot of burst damage, or take the mage away and put an assassin in, if they have a lot of sustained damage. Maybe play it risky and have no tank and 2 fighters and try end the game early. 
That is strategy.

But picking 3 assassins (even more if you have vayne ADC)  just because that class is just straight up better than all the others, is a pathetic way to play the game.

Fizz should NOT be able to take a tank, just like ADC's should NOT be able to take Fizz. 
Zed should NOT be able to 1v1 Illaoi, just like Janna should NOT be able to 1v1 Zed.

every class needs a weakness, Assassins currently have none, their armour pen shreds tanks/fighters, and the passive damage they get from items alone is more than enough to destroy any squishies on the map.

But it turns out that Fizz CAN take tanks with ease, as well as destroying ADC's in under a second.
Zed CAN 1v1 illaoi as well as killing Janna instantly.

Rengar legit just jumps into battle and spams Q as fast as he can until everyone is dead.
Fizz has so much AoE damage, he doesn't even need to select a target, he just throws all his abilities into the fray and takes whatever he gets.
And Kha'Zix is literally impossible to fight in 90% of situations.

I am legitimately begging, please, please, please, can we just have a normal game.

Like pokemon! 
Fire counters Grass, Grass counters Water, Water counters fire. Its a circle.
Everyone has a strength, and a weakness.

There is no fuckin circle in league! 
**Mages** counter ADC's, but are countered by Tanks, Fighters and Assassins.
**ADC's** counter tanks, but are countered by Mages, Fighters and Assassins.
**Fighters** counter Mages, ADC's,tanks, and counter the occasional unlucky assassin.
**Assassins** counter ADC's, Mages, Supports, Tanks, and sometimes fighters, and don't really have a counter except for a few fighters.
Thats a little lop sided if you ask me.

And the line between assassin and fighter is so blurred now that i bet even RIOT no longer knows the difference.

Why not make Assassins = Charmander, Mages/ADC's = Bulbasaur, and Tanks = Squirtle? 

Pokemon, an 8 bit game from the 90's has more balance than league.

Im a mid-lane mage main and its just a one sided slog against assassins every game.
The only mages we see in league now, are the few that faker played in words... 
That it. Its just sad.

Even the powerhouse mages like Vel'koz, Lux and Brand, we don't even see anymore, they are just outclassed by the assassins.
Are you genuinely happy with the state of the game?

replies.body:
Good points
Assassins need a weakness

They have a weakness.

CC.

Literally every single last one of those "opie op" assassin champs that people bitch about are shut down hard by well cc.

Take akali before she got nerfed into the ground, i have almost 1000 games with akali so i like to think i know her ins and outs, and quite frankly she was always a super strong pick into teams that have no hard cc, but if i saw a lux or a morg, or hell a nautilus on the enemy team? i was almost scared to pick akali into a team like that (again before rito nerfed her till shes unplayable, still waiting for that passive reversion rito, you can keep all the other nerfs just give us back our passive) because quite frankly one morg q and it didnt matter how far ahead i was 9/10 i was dead if the enemy team followed up on said morg q.

Hell even the argument of "well how can i outplay it if i die instantly" simple, dont put yourself in a situation where you can die instantly, surround yourself with your team, if there is one thing assassins hate more than anything its having to traverse a mine field of CC just to reach their target.

"Hmmm i know how to counter them! we stop them from being able to attack or move!
surely thats a **_unique_** counter for assassins. Its the one weakness that assassins have that NO ONE ELSE DOES!"

Yea... 

Thats a weakness that EVERY SINGLE CHAMPION has, its not a 'fix' for assassins being OP.


You say "Don't put yourself in a situation where you can die instantly."
But then you wouldn't be able to do anything, Champions like Zed and Yasuo can leap across the entire lane in no time at all. Basically, if you are in range to attack minions, YOU ARE AT RISK OF DYING.

Also i have no idea what your bitch about alkali is, I play alkali just fine now, and Im not even an Akali main. 
_(remember her purpose is to burst down a SINGLE target, not to jump into a fight and get a pentakill, she's an assassin not a fighter, and if you cant burst down an ADC or mage as alkali, theres something majorly wrong with you.)_

Assassins have unique weaknesses that we, the players, need to exploit.

{{champion:84}} : Tank Akali nerfed, so you can just kill her easily
{{champion:245}} : Avoid Timewinder and predict where his zone is going to land and play safe when his ult is up. Tank Ekko is no longer viable.
{{champion:105}} : Avoid fighting him at a long distance with nothing in front of you because of the size of his shark and save your hard hitting spells after you've exploited him to waste his E
{{champion:55}} : Camp at her daggers so she has no reliable escape. If you're low, hit her with hard CC when she engages with her ult
{{champion:121}} : Avoid bushes 
{{champion:7}} : Ward multiple areas. If you see her ulting, smart ping her as the mark will last on the real LeBlanc
{{champion:107}} : Watch for the appropriate mark above champion head when he ults and set up counter measure to protect that person
{{champion:35}} : Avoid his Illuminati and try killing him with ranged attacks
{{champion:91}} : Watch for a flash on walls when he parkours. This indicates which walls he can't jump over and he is significantly weaker when his ult is down.
{{champion:238}} : Reposition when he places a shadow so you can avoid at least one shuriken.

Remember, Assassins are heavily reliant on their combos, so yes, heavy CC can help when countering them. Exploit their reliance on abilities to counter them

Individual assassins have weaknesses (theoretically anyway), but as a class they don't.

ADC's are vulnerable to mages/assassins.
Mages and vulnerable to fighters.
Fighters are vulnerable to tanks.
Tanks are vulnerable to ADC's

Assassins aren't particularly vulnerable to anything.

Its all very well to say "Avoid bushes" but that means that there are very very very few places on that map that you can actually fight.
isnt that a little OP? having a champ that makes it impossible to win if you fight near a bush?

Will all of you just stop saying "oh but CC counters assassins!"
CC fucking counters mages and ADC's too!
Death counters assassins too, but that doesn't make it the unique weakness of assassins.

Most Assassins can be shut down by a tank. I'm a Talon main who can't tell you how many times I couldn't get a Tank/Figher to 3/4 Health because of their resistance to physical damage. It also hurts as these champs (Riven and Lee Sin, in this case) have very effective CC as they can tank the burst damage and/or interrupt your combo ,

Because single target burst is a pure numbers game.

So i would like to introduce you to diana, a champion that has a near identical kit to akali (Ranged q, utility w, and dash ult) only does almost twice the damage, has higher scalings, and is tankier to boot, that and instead of having akalis useless nerfed e (which is only good for wave clear and thats about it) she has CC.

This akali rework? only made the "akali is just diana but weaker" statement even truer, atleast before she was reworked there was a reason to play her instead of diana, and that was dueling potential, if someone didnt immediately blow up you could stick around and wait for cooldowns because you had 50% spell vamp assuming you built two ad items and a gunblade.

With a glass cannon burst diana you cant do that, if you dont blow them up straight away you best believe you either have to run or hope your shield saves your ass.

Granted with diana unlike akali its pretty rare you wont one shot someone in 0.2 seconds, especially if you do the timing trick with her q ult combo to shave off nearly half a second on your combo.
